title-group.article-title: Fast Computation of Multivariate Kernel Estimators

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1994 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: Multivariate extensions of binning techniques for fast computation of kernel estimators are described and examined. Several questions arising from this multivariate extension are addressed. The choice of binning rule is discussed, and it is demonstrated that linear binning leads to substantial accuracy improvements over simple binning. An investigation into the most appropriate means of computing the multivariate discrete convolutions required for binned kernel estimators is also given. The results of an empirical study indicate that, in multivariate settings, the fast Fourier transform offers considerable time savings compared to direct calculation of convolutions.
